newsitem.title: USA: Wang to sell imaging software to Kodak - report.
newsitem.headline: Wang to sell imaging software to Kodak - report.

text.p: Wang Laboratories Inc. is close to selling its imaging software unit to Eastman Kodak Co. for about $200 million, Network World magazine said in its Jan. 27 edition.
Network World, quoting unidentified sources, said the deal could be concluded "any day now," about four months after the companies confirmed their mutual interest.
The deal took so long to wrap up because of worries over tax implications, the loss of key personnel and Wang's deal with Microsoft Corp. to include its image viewer in Windows 95, the magazine said.

Wang's imaging software unit has annual sales of $50 million and is growing, Network World said. Kodak is currently a reseller of Wang's electronic imaging software but lacks its own advanced technology, the magazine said.
Wang did not immediately return phone calls.
Wang's stock was off 37.5 cents at $22.50 on the Nasdaq, and Kodak lost 25 cents to $85.375 on the New York Stock Exchange.
